sense.gloss: persistent, obstinate, tenacious, relentless, insistent, importunate, persevering, stubborn
insistent, obstinate, persistent, tenacious
too rich (taste, etc.), fatty, heavy, greasy
to curve, to twist
to be contrary, to be uncooperative, to be rebellious
to curve, to twist, to be rebellious
to be peevish, to sulk, to pout
to get complicated, to grow worse, to turn sour
contracted sound, palatalised sound (e.g. Japanese morae with small kana), palatalized sound
to get twisted, to get crooked, to get warped
to become twisted (of a mind, relationship, etc.), to become warped, to become perverse, to become contrary
to become troubled, to become complicated, to become strained
to screw, to twist
to distort, to parody, to make a pun
to torture, to wrest
perverse individual, cynic, misanthrope
to aggravate, to complicate, to make worse
to make worse (e.g. disease), to aggravate, to complicate
kink, twist, twirl
girl who has low self esteem

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓に↑迅速↑↓じんそく↓な↑回答↑↓かいとう↓を↑執拗↑↓しつよう↓に↑求↑↓もと↓めた。
sdata.e: He pressed me for a prompt reply.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑執拗↑↓しつこ↓さにうんざりしていた。
sdata.e: She was disgusted at his persistence.

sdata.j: ↑拗音↑↓ようおん↓（ゃ　ゅ　ょ）と↑促音↑↓そくおん↓（っ）の↑出↑↓だ↓し↑方↑↓かた↓も、↑加↑↓くわ↓えていただけると↑参考↑↓さんこう↓になるかもしれません。
sdata.e: I think it might be useful if you could add how to output the diphthongs (with small ya/yu/yo) and geminate consonants (with small tsu).

sdata.j: あの↑子供↑↓こども↓は↑親↑↓おや↓に↑相手↑↓あいて↓をしてもらえず↑拗↑↓す↓ねている。
sdata.e: That child is sulking without its parents.

sdata.j: 「ふん！↑帰↑↓かえ↓りたいなら、↑勝手↑↓かって↓にすればいい！」ピーター・パンは↑拗↑↓す↓ねて、どこかへ↑飛↑↓と↓んで↑行↑↓い↓ってしまいました。
sdata.e: Hmph! Go ahead, go back home if you want!, Peter Pan said with a sulk as he flew away.
